description: An expandable walk through Kuring-gai Chase to Bobbin Head with an optional extention to the Sphynx Memorial. The overgrown pipeline shortcut track to Apple Tree Bay is strongly discouraged.

markers.description: Get the train to Mount Kuring-gai using transportnsw.info.
Exit the station to the left and cross the overpass over the M1.
From the cul-de-sac follow Harwood Ave straight on.
At the corner of Harwood Ave follow the Mount Kuring-gai track.
At the split follow the trail to the left.
+0.2km Optionally follow the split to the right to a lookout.
-1km From the lookout an overgrown trail leads further down the ridge and ultimately to Apple Tree Bay.
It is not advised to follow this dangerous pipeline service trail.
The trail ends at the abandoned structure of a water tank.
From the water tank a disused pipeline leads to Apple Tree Bay.
Cross the creek instead of following it to the waterfall. The pipe line continues on the other side.
The pipeline service trail ends with a scramble down to the Apple Tree Bay picnic area.
The leads to a set of steps down a drop.
+50mBefore the steps down, an overgrown side trail to the left leads to a lookout and memorial.
At the bottom of the steps, continue along the Mt Kuring-gai Track
At the end of the trail a lookout overlooks Cowan Creek.
From the lookout follow the hairpin turns down to Cowan Creek.
Follow the Berowra Track to the right along the waterfront.
The trail ends at a small picnic area along the Apple Tree Creek.
From the small picnic area at the end of the track, cross the bridge to Apple Tree Bay.
There is a public toilet at the carpark.
From the cafe follow the road to Bobbin Head.
There are public toilets at the carpark near Bobbin Head Inn.
There is a restaurant and visitor information at Bobbin Head Inn.
+12kmCross the bridge and enter the marina to the left. The trail continues at the far end of the marina.
Follow the trail along the creek.
At the intersection in the trail, follow the signs up to the Sphynx War Memorial.
At the junction at the top of the climb, continue to the right towards to the Sphynx War Memorial.
From the war memorial follow the car park to the road out of the national park.
Past the hospital follow Du Faur St right, Kirkpatrick St left, and Murrua St right to the next trail head.
At the junction in the firetrail, follow the direction to the Gibberagong Track.
Another junction leads down a rougher trail to the left into the gully and down to the Gibberagong track.
After descending down to the creek, follow the sign to Bobbin Head to the right.
Follow the walking trail along the creek.
The trail ends at a rocky outcrop, with Aboriginal stone cuttings.
Past the stone cuttins, follow the boardwalk through the mangroves.
Cross the bridge at the end of the mangroves and follow the path back onto the Bobbin Head picnic area.
To the left of the steps lead up the Birrawanna Track.
The trail passes between a narrow gap between the rocks.
At the intersection cross the firetrail and continue straight on to the Kalkari Dicrovery Centre.
Follow the trail on the right side of the fence line.
The trial end at the carpark of the Kalkari Discovery Centre.
There are public toilets at the Kalkari Visitor Centre.
From the exit of the carpark, follow the Kalkari Walking Track on the left side of Kuring-gai Chase Rd.
Cross the powerline service trail and continue along the Kalkari Track on the other side.
From the lookout near the powerlines, follow the Kalkari Track to the right.
When all else fails: Power line service trails.
markers.title: Electrifying View
markers.instruction: Visit this location to earn the mystery trophy

markers.description: Follow the Kalkari Track along the power lines.
The trail continues a short distance past the park entrance booth.
After the park entrance booths exit the trail onto Kuring-gai Chase Rd.
Cross Kuring-gai Chase Rd and follow the bike and footpath to the left.
Cross the overpass across the M1 along the footpath.
After the overpass follow Myall Rd to the right.
There are public toilets when the sports fields are being used.
Continue on Myall Rd past the sports fields.
Follow Cowan Rd to the left.
At the end of Cowan Rd follow Belmont Pde to the right.
Enter the station entrance across the cul-de-sac.
Plan your return trip from Mount Colah at transportnsw.info.
